title: Ashley Cole preparing for life after football as former Chelsea left-back shows off 'homework' notes
text:

Former England left-back Ashley Cole is taking his first steps towards a career after football. 
Cole, 36, is still with LA Galaxy but is eyeing a scouting role once he hangs up his boots. 
With the MLS season yet to get underway, Cole has been using his time off to work towards his qualification. 
The former Chelsea man posted uploaded an image of notebooks alongside some tactical points. 
"Hotel life = home work studying the game from different aspects," read the caption. 
Cole has previously tried his hand at punditry but would rather focus his work on unearthing the next generation of stars. 
And he hopes a role will come up at Stamford Bridge for him, in the future. 
”I hope I can go back to Chelsea and do something there, not so much coaching but scouting or something," he said last year. Cole with Cesar Azpilicueta during Chelsea's pre-season tour in America (Photo: Twitter/@CesarAzpi) Cole in action for Chelsea (Photo: Warren Little) 
“I enjoy scouting, watching the young lads come through. I have done a little for my agent, but I’d like to do something a bit more serious. I’d love to go back to work at Chelsea somewhere, somehow. 
“When you win the Champions League as I did with Chelsea, it is the ultimate. 
"Just the feeling to know I have played in a team and won a trophy that a lot of teams would want to win. You play against all the big teams." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
